summary.para: Creates an exact copy of the property store object.

param.name: pPropStore
param.para: Pointer to an interface pointer that receives the new property store object.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

remarks.para: This method creates a new property store object and initializes the new object so that it will operate as an exact copy of the original property store object. The new object must be completely independent of the original object.

summary.para: Called when the text covered by the property is split into two ranges.

param.name: pRangeThis
param.para: Pointer to an object that contains the range that the property store now covers. This will be the range of text closest to the beginning of the context.

param.name: pRangeNew
param.para: Pointer to an ITfRange object that contains the range that the new property store will cover. This will be the range of text closest to the end of the context.

param.name: ppPropStore
param.para: Pointer to an interface pointer that receives a new property store object that will cover the range specified by pRangeNew.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

remarks.para: This method creates a new property store object to cover pRangeNew and returns the pointer to this object in ppPropStore. If no new property store is returned, the original property store is discarded and the property store for both ranges is set to empty.
If this method returns any value other than S_OK, the original property store is discarded.

param.name: pvarValue
param.para: Pointer to a VARIANT value that receives property data.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

summary.para: This method is reserved, but must be implemented.

param.name: pdwReserved
param.para: Pointer to a DWORD value the receives the data type. This parameter is reserved and must be set to zero.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Obtains the class identifier of the property store owner.

param.name: pclsid
param.para: Pointer to a CLSID that receives the class identifier of the registered text service that implements . The method can return CLSID_NULL for this parameter if property store persistence is unsupported.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

remarks.para: When the property store is unserialized, the TSF manager creates an object of this CLSID and obtains an ITfCreatePropertyStore interface pointer from it. The manager then uses the ITfCreatePropertyStore object to create the property store object.

param.name: pguid
param.para: Pointer to a GUID value that receives the property identifier.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

summary.para: Called when the text that the property store applies to is modified.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Contains a set of flags that provide additional information about the text change. This can be zero or the following value.

description.para: The text change is the result of a correction. This implies that the semantics of the text have not changed. An example of this is when the spelling checker corrects a misspelled word.

param.name: pRangeNew
param.para: Pointer to an interface that contains the range of text modified.

param.name: pfAccept
param.para: Pointer to a BOOL variable that receives a value that indicates if the property store should be retained. Receives a nonzero value if the property store should be retained or zero if the property store should be discarded. If the property store is discarded, the TSF manager will set the property value to VT_EMPTY and release the property store.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

remarks.para: If this method returns any value other than S_OK, the property store is discarded.

summary.para: Called to write the property store data into a stream for serialization.

param.name: pStream
param.para: Pointer to an IStream object that the property store data is written to.

param.name: pcb
param.para: Pointer to a ULONG value that receives the number of bytes written to the stream.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: One or more parameters are invalid.

remarks.para: The method must not move the stream insertion point before writing to the stream. The method must leave the insertion point at the end of the data written by the method.

summary.para: Called when the text that the property store applies to is truncated.

param.name: pRangeNew
param.para: Pointer to an interface that contains the truncated range.

param.name: pfFree
param.para: Pointer to a BOOL variable that receives a value that indicates if the property store should be retained. Receives a nonzero value if the property store should be retained or zero if the property store should be discarded. If the property store is discarded, the TSF manager will set the property value to VT_EMPTY and release the property store.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

remarks.para: If this method returns a value other than S_OK, the property store is discarded.

summary.para: The ITfPropertyStore interface is implemented by a text service and used by the TSF manager to provide non-static property values. An instance of this interface is passed to .
